page.title: 04Guides float "Flame" on raft
page.content: On Friday June 28th 1985 those Guides in our company who were allowed to stay out until 11.00pm met Chil at St Pauls Hall, Bretch Hill Banbury. From there we walked in the rain to the brook near the Wroxton Abbey estate below the Folly. The Rangers were already there. They had lit a fire and were baking jacket potatoes. We ate these while the beefburgers were cooking. After a drink we went into the woods and sat around the "Flame" and sang campfire songs. When this was over two people were enrolled into the Guides. They had to say the Guides promise and were given their badge. After the enrollment Chil lit candles in each patrol leaders tin-foil raft. These were then put into the brook and they floated away with their candles burning. When the lights had gone out we cleared up and returned home.
